title: The AIIB Fails on Public Access to Information
description: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank's (AIIB) newly revised environmental and social framework appears to tick all the boxes, but it includes too many loopholes and caveats that undermine accountability and public access to information.

title: Material Advantage: FOIP and U.S. Alliances in Asia
description: This week, Mike is back in the studio with Heino Klinck, former Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for East Asia, to unpack the Free and Open Indo-Pacific Strategy and how it relates to U.S. allies and partners.

title: Previewing the High-Level General Debate at UNGA 76
description: CSIS will host a press call on Friday, September 17, 2021 at 3:00 p.m. ET to preview the high-level General Debate at the 76th Session of the UN General Assembly.

title: Encouraging Small Business Procurement in Indian States
description: This white paper draws on leading international examples and best practices from Indian states in promoting small business involvement in the government procurement process. It proposes policy interventions to help Indian states strengthen their procurement policy.

title: By Air, Land, and Sea: China’s Maritime Power Projection Network
description: China’s deployment of radar, missiles, and combat aircraft to its outposts in the South China Sea has greatly expanded its ability to project power in distant waters. See how these capabilities enable Chinese carrier operations in a new map from AMTI.

title: Transparency with Chinese Characteristics: Xiaomi’s First Report
description: In June 2021, Chinese smartphone giant Xiaomi released the inaugural edition of its transparency report, meant to explain how the company responds to information requests from governments around the world.

title: In Southeast Asia, Privatized Vaccination Schemes Gain Traction
description: Across developing Southeast Asia, governments have turned to privatized vaccination schemes to supplement free vaccines given directly to citizens.

title: A New Partnership Agenda with the Hemisphere
description: The United States should turn its attention back to its shared neighborhood, where there are major opportunities to build ambitious partnerships with the Western Hemisphere, not merely for the Western Hemisphere.

title: The Latest on Southeast Asia: September 16, 2021
description: The United States and China avoided a showdown over who would represent Myanmar in the United Nations by brokering a deal this week to delay the decision until at least November.

title: U.S. Leadership and Vietnamese Resilience Both Require the CPTPP
description: Vietnam heavily depends on China for capital and intermediate goods, creating vulnerabilities in the country’s entire production chain. Solving this challenge will require the United States to reengage with free trade in the Indo-Pacific.

title: The Seeds of Another Trade War over Clean Energy
description: The Biden administration needs to offer a more coherent theory for how to reconcile its push for domestic jobs and manufacturing with a trade system that prevents countries from favoring local producers over foreign ones.

title: U.S. Policy on Remittances to Cuba: What Are Some Viable Options?
description: Restrictive U.S. policies on remittances to Cuba, coupled with corruption in the country, have halted essential flows of remittances to Cuban citizens.
